text: A pretty damning report on how London councils respond to FOI requests and the regulator’s failure to act when they break the law. The main losers in all this: citizens and their trust in govt institutions. https://www.cfoi.org.uk/2019/03/london-councils-foi-performance-assessed/ …
author: newsbrooke

text: Congrats to the shortlisted winners of British Press Awards. This year’s more rigorous judging methodology seems to have opened the way for more female reporters.  https://www.societyofeditors.org/events/national-press-awards/national-press-awards-shortlist/ …
author: newsbrooke

text: There’s a much bigger investigation to be done here.
author: newsbrooke

text: Let’s hope the electricity doesn’t fail then all your frozen meals will melt!
author: newsbrooke

text: Well done Poppy! @cityjournalism investigative student @poppyeh reports for @FT on Presidents Club a year on:
author: newsbrooke

text: I first heard it in America. it seems to have crept over here. Ghastly.
author: newsbrooke

text: No local journalism? A public too snowed over by social media to notice/care?
author: newsbrooke

text: Oh dear. Sounds like you're having a blast.
author: newsbrooke

text: Yes sorry to miss you afterwards. Would be great to catch up.
author: newsbrooke

text: @MattHeineman If/when you're in London would love to have you come talk to our students. I met you (briefly) when you spoke at CartelLand screening at Columbia Uni.
author: newsbrooke

text: Yes indeed: “every day the media’s favorite social network [twitter] tugs journalists deeper into the rip currents of tribal melodrama, short-circuiting our better instincts in favor of mob- and bot-driven groupthink”
author: newsbrooke

text: Congratulations Samira. It was a great speech.
author: newsbrooke

text: Ha! “the British political class has offered to the world an astounding spectacle of mendacious, intellectually limited hustlers.”
author: newsbrooke

text: Now on BBC Radio 4 - The Battles That Won Our Freedoms, 10 Freedom of Information
author: newsbrooke

text: Here’s another version of how MPs’ expenses were revealed. Tune in tomorrow @BBCRadio4 . https://www.bbc.co.uk/programmes/m000222q …
author: newsbrooke

text: Tune in tomorrow 1:45pm ⁦@BBCRadio4⁩ . We’ll be discussing official secrecy and freedom of information 10 years after MPs’ expenses. ⁦ https://www.bbc.co.uk/programmes/m000222q …
author: newsbrooke

text: wait - didn’t I break that? There’d be nothing to report if no disc. No disc without litigating and winning at the High Court. That was four years of journalistic work. No checkbook signed.
author: newsbrooke

text: Excellent thread. You always manage to burn through the BS and get right to the heart of the matter.
author: newsbrooke

text: But we were told all those intrusive surveillance laws were supposed to ‘make us safer’. You mean they haven’t worked? Who would have thought.
author: newsbrooke

text: you could always get off twitter and do some grading ;)
author: newsbrooke
